title: Outside Scholarships  · Angelo State University
description: Many community and professional organizations offer scholarships. Get tips on finding, applying for, and accepting these types of scholarships.

headings: Keep Up with Your Outside Scholarships
How Scholarships Affect Other Forms of Financial Aid
paragraphs: ASU encourages you to continue your scholarship search through unaffiliated organizations online. Below are examples of the types of organizations that may have scholarships for students.
Community foundations strive to improve the quality of life of their surrounding area by helping philanthropic people donate funds, including several scholarships, to benefit the region.
Here are some links to examples of community foundations:

Philanthropic organizations like the ones below focus on promoting the welfare of others, and may offer scholarships to students. Some organizations are for specific populations based on race, disability, religious affiliation, and many other determinants.
Here are some links to examples of these organizations:
If you are serving or have served in the military, here are some scholarship opportunities for you. This list also includes scholarships for spouses and dependents.
Professional organizations provide community and networking opportunities to professionals in specific fields of work. Not all professional organizations have scholarships, but many do.
Here are some links to examples of professional organizations:
Below are a few examples of scholarship databases. You may notice an increased amount of junk mail in your email inbox if you register with a scholarship database website.
Always keep an eye out for any possible scams (charging a fee, scholarship drawings, etc.) as many databases do not review the applications thoroughly.
Review theFederal Trade Commission’s Consumer Informationwebpage for more information about recognizing and reporting scholarship scams.
All financial aid and scholarships will be applied toward your student bill. If you receive financial aid and scholarships in excess of your bill, you will be refunded via yourASU OneCard.
More Refund Information
Have you been notified that you will receive a scholarship from outside of ASU (high school, church, business, etc.)? If yes, follow the steps below to ensure your checks arrive on time!
Please complete our “Outside Scholarship Form” below to let us know you will be receiving any scholarships outside of ASU so we can prepare your award appropriately.
You do not have to include any scholarships that you have been awarded from Angelo State University (i.e., ASU Distinguished, Band, Cheerleading, etc.).
Outside Scholarship Form

Your scholarship donor will make the check payable to Angelo State University on your behalf. To ensure speedy processing of your scholarship award, provide the donor with your ASU Campus ID (CID) number and our mailing address.
Office of Financial Aid and ScholarshipsASU Station #11015San Angelo, TX 76909
When our office receives and processes a check for you, we will send you an award notice to your ASU email account.

Your scholarship donors may ask for proof of your enrollment. There are several ways you can provide this information. Most donors will accept a copy of either your class schedule or bill from RamPort.
To request enrollment verification be sent by the Registrar’s Office, please complete the Enrollment Verification Form.
Enrollment Verification Form
The Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships cannot release proof of enrollment to donors due to theFamily Educational Rights and Privacy Act(FERPA).
We keep a list of your Outside Scholarships as resources on RamPort. To follow the progress of your outside scholarships, please follow the steps below.

In the example below, the student let us know he would receive scholarships from the Norris Foundation and Burger King. Our office received the Burger King check and processed it as indicated by the cash receipt (CR) number beside the scholarship name. Our office has not received the Norris Foundation check yet as there isnota CR number beside the name.
Our office will process scholarships exactly as the donor outlines. Should the donor not specify which term(s) the funds should be disbursed, we will automatically award funds as indicated below.

Scholarships may impact existing financial aid awards, so the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships will review your continued eligibility for federal, state and institutional grant/loan programs with every scholarship awarded.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

Look for scholarships at professional organizations for your career field.
Spend an hour a day on scholarship applications.
Refrain from explaining the financial burden of college. Instead, discuss how earning a degree will enhance your future.

Let Us KnowPlease complete our “Outside Scholarship Form” below to let us know you will be receiving any scholarships outside of ASU so we can prepare your award appropriately.You do not have to include any scholarships that you have been awarded from Angelo State University (i.e., ASU Distinguished, Band, Cheerleading, etc.).Outside Scholarship Form

Let the Donor KnowYour scholarship donor will make the check payable to Angelo State University on your behalf. To ensure speedy processing of your scholarship award, provide the donor with your ASU Campus ID (CID) number and our mailing address.Office of Financial Aid and ScholarshipsASU Station #11015San Angelo, TX 76909When our office receives and processes a check for you, we will send you an award notice to your ASU email account.

Proof of EnrollmentYour scholarship donors may ask for proof of your enrollment. There are several ways you can provide this information. Most donors will accept a copy of either your class schedule or bill from RamPort.Class ScheduleLog in toRamPort.Navigate to the Academics > Registration page.Select the “View Schedule” icon at the top of the page.Select the appropriate term and click “Submit.”Student BillLog in toRamPort.Navigate to the Paying for College > Student Accounts page.Select the “View Bill” icon at the top of the page.Select the appropriate term and click “Submit.”Enrollment Verification FormTo request enrollment verification be sent by the Registrar’s Office, please complete the Enrollment Verification Form.Enrollment Verification FormThe Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships cannot release proof of enrollment to donors due to theFamily Educational Rights and Privacy Act(FERPA).
Navigate to the Academics > Registration page.
Select the “View Schedule” icon at the top of the page.
Select the appropriate term and click “Submit.”
Navigate to the Paying for College > Student Accounts page.
Select the “View Bill” icon at the top of the page.
Select the appropriate term and click “Submit.”

Keep Up with Your Outside ScholarshipsWe keep a list of your Outside Scholarships as resources on RamPort. To follow the progress of your outside scholarships, please follow the steps below.Log in toRamPort.Navigate to the Paying for College > Financial Aid & Scholarships page.Click the “View/Accept Financial Aid Awards” button.Select the appropriate term and click “Submit.”Select the “Resources/Additional Information” tab.In the example below, the student let us know he would receive scholarships from the Norris Foundation and Burger King. Our office received the Burger King check and processed it as indicated by the cash receipt (CR) number beside the scholarship name. Our office has not received the Norris Foundation check yet as there isnota CR number beside the name.
Navigate to the Paying for College > Financial Aid & Scholarships page.
Click the “View/Accept Financial Aid Awards” button.
Select the appropriate term and click “Submit.”

Awarding of Your ScholarshipsOur office will process scholarships exactly as the donor outlines. Should the donor not specify which term(s) the funds should be disbursed, we will automatically award funds as indicated below.Awards of $500 or Less - Fall only or Spring onlyAwards greater than $500 - Split between the Fall/Spring semesters
Awards of $500 or Less - Fall only or Spring only
Awards greater than $500 - Split between the Fall/Spring semesters
